text: Select yes or no to identify whether each statement applies to you:
I am bothered by or feel discomfort wearing wool clothes, clothes with tags or socks with seams

Doing some self-care tasks such as washing face, brushing teeth and/or brushing
hair bothers me

Materials with a lot of tactile (touch) input, such as lotion, shaving cream or foods,
bother me
Textures of some foods, like mashed potatoes, and/or soup with chunks, bother me
Intense visual sensory input, such as sunlight and/or fluorescent lights, bother me

Visual sensory input, like cluttered environments and/or busy patterns on paper or
fabric, bother me
Loud sounds, such as alarms, airplanes flying overhead and sirens, bother me

Some noises, like blenders, vacuum cleaners, toilet flushing, people chewing and/or
machinery humming, bother me

Sounds, such as a busy shopping mall, sporting events, and/or restaurants,
bother me
Some smells, such as perfumes, cleaners and/or food odors, are bothersome to me
Certain tastes bother me such as salty, spicy and/or most vegetables

Climbing, heights and/or going up and down open staircases are uncomfortable or
frightening for me

Fast movements with spinning or changes in direction, like sports, amusement park
rides or abrupt car movements bother me

I have a very low pain tolerance; I may get overly focus on a mild injury or
discomfort

I frequently complain or seem to be very sensitive to bodily functions, such as
hunger or feeling ill
I often do not notice food or other substances left on my mouth, face or lips

I often do not notice or respond to touch experiences, like clothing twisted on my
body

I often have a less intense response to pain, such as bruising or touching a hot
surface, than others
I do not respond consistently when my name is called or often I ignore others
I often need instructions to be repeated and appear to not hear well at times

I often do not respond to environmental cues and/or often may appear to be in
my own world

I do not notice when others come into a room or may have trouble locating objects
in a room

I often do not respond to intense movement, like swinging high or carnival rides,
with excitement
I like to spin and spin and never seem to get dizzy
I respond less intensely to tastes, like sour or spicy food, than other people
I do not notice specific foul or pleasant smells

I am less aware of feelings within my body, such as fatigue, being hungry or
needing to use the toilet

I am often unaware of how my body feels when experiencing emotions such as joy,
sadness, worry and/or feeling overwhelmed

I have an unusually persistent desire for fast movement activities like jumping,
swinging, spinning and running

I have an unusual desire for deliberately falling or crashing into people/objects
throughout the day

I have difficulty sitting still, I fidget and/or am often restless, which interferes with
completing daily tasks
I often engage in movement activities without regard for safety; I am accident-prone

I like hearing my own voice; I may interrupt others, talk loudly, make odd noises
or talk excessively to myself

Despite normal hearing, I like the volume on electronic devices high and/or I like
to make loud noises
I have an unusual desire to look at bright, contrasting, moving, or spinning objects
I have an unusual desire to stare at people or objects

I have difficulty disengaging from touching certain kinds of objects/textures like
very smooth, bumpy and/or vibrating objects
I sometimes touch others to the point of irritating them

I tend to put non-food items in my mouth; I sometimes chew on pencils or clothing
and/or I lick objects

I have an unusual desire to smell people and/or objects like my significant other,
or my hands after touching someone or something
I have very strong food/taste preferences; I crave certain tastes/flavors
I seem to tire easily
I have trouble keeping up with others during outdoor play or sports
I have poor posture and often slump at a desk/table or lean against walls or furniture
My muscles seem weak

I have a weak/awkward pencil grasp, I have trouble turning knobs or opening
packages
My balance seems poor; I have trouble keeping balance in a moving vehicle
I seem to have poor endurance during physical activity

I often have difficulty coordinating body movement such as jumping jacks,
clapping games and/or bike riding

I often have difficulty keeping track of the page when I read or copy on paper
from the board

I often have difficulty following a moving object with my eyes; I do not visually
scan environment well

I have difficulty using scissors, catching a small ball, tying knots/bows, buttoning
a shirt, climbing a ladder and/or driving a car
I fall often and/or trip when walking or running on uneven surfaces
I am ambidextrous and do not like to reach across my body to grab objects
I do not always catch myself when falling

I am difficult to understand when I speak and/or I have speech/articulation
problems
I have difficulty following a multiple step, verbal direction
I have difficulty learning new, multiple step movement activities or games
I have difficulty following rhythms or performing smooth, rhythmical movements
I have difficulty formulating new ideas to use materials creatively
I get lost easily and have trouble negotiating within my environment
I tend to move slowly and often use inefficient ways of doing things

I have difficulty learning new movement tasks, like sports, yoga, dance
moves or Pilates

I seem clumsy/awkward when doing tasks and during gross motor activities; I may
bump into things/people

I usually prefer sedentary activities, like TV, computer games and/or reading, to
movement activities
I often talk through new actions or simple motor tasks

I often have difficulty using small, manipulative objects, like board game pieces,
and/or doing other fine motor tasks, like snapping my fingers

I have trouble with some fine motor work/school activities, like handwriting,
keyboarding, texting, using a stapler, hole punch or tape dispenser

I have trouble with daily life fine motor tasks, like using feeding utensils and doing
dressing fasteners

I have difficulty with dressing; I may put clothes on backwards or inside out, I take
a long time/I am slow

I often have difficulty finding or locating things in a drawer, closet, or other busy
background
I have difficulty matching objects by shape or size, such as a triangle versus diamond

I have difficulty differentiating similar looking objects or symbols, like
a "b" versus "d"
I have difficulty knowing what direction or where sounds are coming from

I have difficulty understanding language and distinguishing similar words or sounds
(e.g., caT versus caP)

I have difficulty doing tasks with my arms and hands, without using my eyes, like
finding objects in a pocket or backpack
I have difficulty handling small objects in my hands

I have difficulty distinguishing features of objects with my hands, such as textures,
size and shape

I have difficulty judging distance and timing during gross motor activities; I am
inaccurate during sports that involve ball play
I often get lost in familiar environments; I may get disoriented when moving around

I have difficulty judging the correct amount of force when hugging others and/or
using a pencil or eraser

I have difficulty knowing how much or where food is in my mouth, and/or knowing
how hard to chew

I have difficulty judging proper speed, direction or accuracy of movement during
tasks; I am often awkward

I have difficulty identifying and differentiating smells such as food odors, perfumes
or foul odors
I have difficulty distinguishing different tastes

I have difficulty identifying/labelling emotions associated with how my body
feels (e.g., bored, frustrated)

When not feeling well or when I am hurt, I have difficulty identifying or describing
where or what feels bad
